abstract: The prime minister asks how a ship could have plowed into a well- documented reef in calm waters.
snippet: The prime minister asks how a ship could have plowed into a well- documented reef in calm waters.
lead_paragraph: Five days after a container ship hit a reef, clumps of oil begin washing up on New Zealand's North Island, stirring fear that the fuel could foul delicate estuaries. Workers had begun pumping fuel from the ship but halted the effort after weather predictions of gale-force winds. [Associated Press]

headline.main: On Our Radar: Oil Spill Off New Zealand
